text: The Same Old Tired Shtick  —  The Harris-Walz barnstorming tour heads for the Sun Belt today, with rallies scheduled in Arizona and Nevada.  As Politico notes this morning, those events will provide an interesting test for “whether Walz's folksy, Midwestern brand can resonate beyond middle America.”

The Government Spends Millions to Open Grocery Stores in Food Deserts.  The Real Test Is Their Survival.  —  The community of Cairo, Illinois, once a food desert, welcomed its new market last year with balloons and cheers.  But the store is struggling — exposing problems with the programs set up to help.
